problem: It takes 15 men working steadily 4 days to dig the foundation for a new apartment.  How many days would it have taken 25 men working at the same rate to dig the foundation?  Express your answer as a decimal to the nearest tenth.
model_solution:
Let \(x=\) number of days to dig the foundation for 25 men.
\[\frac{15\text{ men}\times 4\text{ days}}{25\text{ men}}=x\text{ days}\]
Cross multiply: 15x = 25 × 4
Divide both sides by 15: x = (25 × 4) / 15
Divide both sides by 25: x = (25 × 4) / 15
x = 100 / 15
Divide 100 by 15.
x = 6.67
x = 6.67
steps:
Let \(x=\) number of days to dig the foundation for 25 men.
\[\frac{15\text{ men}\times 4\text{ days}}{25\text{ men}}=x\text{ days}\]

Divide both sides by 25: x = (25 × 4) / 15
x = 100 / 15
full_steps:
Let \(x=\) number of days to dig the foundation for 25 men.
\[\frac{15\text{ men}\times 4\text{ days}}{25\text{ men}}=x\text{ days}\]

Divide both sides by 25: x = (25 × 4) / 15
x = 100 / 15
